### Histogram of the Chances Variable
This data is right-skewed with most of the values over 0.65, however there are some very small numbers on the left.
source.efd3e245:
### Create a histogram of the Statement of Purpose and Letter of Recommendation Strength 
Again, this histogram is slightly skewed to the left. It is interesting that there are no values between 2.6 and 3. These variables are qualitative since they are a judgement as to how strong the letters are. This scale is dependent upon how someone rates the "strength" of a letter so it is not surprising that the values will not be fully represented.

source.99dff2ef:
### Dataset Description
The dataset contains several parameters which are considered important during the application for Masters Programs. 
The parameters included are : 
1. GRE Scores ( out of 340 ) 
2. TOEFL Scores ( out of 120 ) 
3. University Rating 
( out of 5 ) 
4. Statement of Purpose and Letter of Recommendation Strength ( out of 5 ) 
5. Undergraduate GPA ( out of 10 ) 
6. Research Experience ( either 0 or 1 ) 
7. Chance of Admit ( ranging from 0 to 1 )
source.1372ded5: The mean and median are very close, and the mode is on either side of the mean which is seen in normal distributions, however, the mode is not evenly spaced and accounts for the histogram's shape.
source.7501a76e:
### Create a histogram of GRE scores 
This is helpful to visually see how the data is dispersed. A histogram shows how often each data value in the particular data set occurs. There are different general categories of distributions. For GRE scores, the data looks pretty evenly distributed, perhaps skewed to the left a bit. It would make sense that graduate application data values would be skewed to the left as candidates with lower scores would probably not apply as often, while many over-qualified candidates apply to at least one safety school.
source.7807d0ff:
### Box plot for chances
Note there is an outlier at the bottom (the open circle). Combining the histogram and the boxplot allows you to identify outliers.
source.9492dbbe: I'd like to see how many rows and columns I have, to get an idea about how much data there is.
source.a70e5909:

Return a list of unique values of TOEFL scores.
source.1616c131: To look at the data more closely, look at the measures of central tendency: mean, mode, and median of the GRE scores variable. Note that the median and mean are close which means there are not many outliers (which we could see in the histogram). Median is the reflects the middle position of the data values. The median is 317 and the mean is 316.5, so the mean is slightly less than the median which is one indicator of a slight skew.

source.e3dc3169:
### Evaluate the SOP variable
In looking at the mean, mode and median - the mean is close to the median. The mode is 4, and looking at the histogram, most of the ratings are clustered in the 3 - 4 range, so above average strength (on a 5-point scale).
source.4abd7452:
The describe() method shows information about each column. One thing to note (as seen above in the info() method, there are no null values. The GRE values hare spread from a minimum score of 290 to a maximum score of 340. The TOEFL scores range from 92 to 120. The rating range is from 1 to 5. Letters of recommendation's range is from 1 to 5, and cgpa is from 6.8 to 9.92. Finally, the range for research is from 0 to 1. The standard deviations are higher for the gre and toefl, this makes sense since the numbers are much larger than for the other variables. 

Get the average GRE Score, SOP, University rating, GPA

source.7c9db5c0: I prefer to remove the spaces in column names and make them all lowercase when doing analysis in pandas. It's easier to work with columns without spaces and not in title case.
source.0890b678:
There are two datatypes in this dataset: int64, whole numbers and float64, decimal numbers. 

Use head to see the first 5 lines of the data. It is helpful to see the data so that you know what kind of values to expect and if there are any formatting issues (extra spaces, extended ascii characters, etc).

source.0a2a55aa: Now look at the statisics for the dataset: count, mean, std, min value, 25th percentile, 50th percentile, 75th percentile, max value
source.1ae96625: In looking at the data, the higher correlations are between the GRE and TOEFL scores have a correlation of 0.82720. This makes sense, since the GRE has two parts, math and English, and TOEFL is for English-language proficiency. If one scored highly on at least the English portion of the GRE they would also score highly on the TOEFL, and vice versa. CGPA, TOEFL, GRE, and chance of admittance are all highly correlated. Again, this makes sense because admittance to university would be related to how high they scored on the exams and how will they did during their undergraduate education (CGPA).
